reviews.sentence: Ordinary. I needed a hotel near the airport for an early morning flight and found this one. The exterior is pleasant enough as is the lobby. I was placed on the top floor with the concierge lounge which served some simple snacks and drinks. The room was ordinary. Ordinary furniture carpet bed bathroom desk. Nothing stand out at all. This property still suffers from the idiotic Mariot concept which frankly is falling out of favor of refusing to put a refrigerator in the room. This is Phoenix it was over 10F during my visit and I have a beg for a refrigerator so I can have a cold glass of water in the morning when I wake up. Of all the places to not give me a refrigeratorHotel staff were quick enough to provide one but of course when you constantly move a refrigerator around from one room to another for months on end they get beat up scratched become noisy. Am I really so odd as to want a bottle of cold water on hand when it is 10F outsideI was also disappointed by the woeful Internet speeds. I gave up trying to stream one of my favorite TV shows and used the hotspot on my phone burning through tons of data in the process. As best I can tell this hotel does not offer premium or standard Internet it is free but it is garbage. Slow and inexcusable. My final point of irritation was THE ENVELOPE PLEASE left on my desk which is a Mariot corporate initiative to encourage me to pay for the privilege of having a clean romthat is right the corporation who collected almost 13 billion dollars in revenue in 2013 the last year I could see a report for want me to pay their house keeping staff because they do not want towhat is next. A tip jar at check in. Heres your room key sir and it is customary to drop 5 in our tip jar. I could have overlooked most of the annoyances of this hotel if the Internet had worked properly. But it did not and there is no excuse. Just as there is no excuse for not equipping the rooms on the special Platinum Elite top floor with refrigerators as standard. Sorry but they are going to have to step up their game. There are plenty of superior properties in the vicinity of the airport and ordinary is not good enough.

Customer Service Saves This Rating. Mariot has done an exceptional job at prioritizing the customer experience. That is the only reason this is a 4 stay. The property is dated for sure and hot water is an issue. My room was average and truly for 279 in Phoenix I expected a bit better. I only stayed here because I arrived into town early last minute and the Buttes property was not available until the next day. Again Mariot truly leaves a great impression with service. It almost masks the challenges the property itself has.

Amazing Service. Hotel Itself Needs a Refresh. As has been noted in other reviews the guest rooms definitely need a refresh. The decor and finishing are like a throwback to the 1980s. The meals I had in the Red Rim Bistro and from catering were actually better than you might expect in a hotel especially one near the airport. I want to particularly commend Brian who drives the shuttle to the airport. He picked me up on my way to the hotel and was incredibly welcoming and friendly. When I was leaving in a rush to get to my flight Brian took it upon himself to immediately drive me over to the airport. Give this man a raise.

Average Mariot. The exterior of this hotel looks good. The landscaping gives you the impression of high end hotel. However the room decor is another story. It really looks dated and it is time to update the room in order to keep up the Mariot brand. We were at the 12 floor and got the mountain view. It was a pleasant surpriseThe breakfast at the lounge was disappointing as compared with the other sub brand like Residence Inn or F airfield Inn where they provide free breakfast to all customers. For the price of the room vs the quality of the hotel it will be hard to attract repeat customer to this hotel.

Looks nice from outside clean lobby. Fast elevators but hallways and rooms need to be updated. Old looking. Felt like I was in a old hotel in Las Vegas. The bedding was very comfortable. This just was not what I would expect from a Mariot.

Like Grandmas Spare Bedroom. Real estate agents would describe this hotel as cozy or it has character. With wallpaper old bathroom gold fixtures and dated furniture the only thing lacking is mothballs to bring back memories of staying in grandmas spare bedroom. I felt like I walked into a time capsule of at least 10 years ago. Very dated. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. When the lights are off you can not tell the age. The hotel overlooks the interstate so road noise can be intrusive. The staff was very friendly and the front of the hotel is nice. Yes it is convenient to the airport but so are many other hotels that are updated.

Good but. Great staff excellent morning cook to order and comfortable room but thin walls in rooms. The bar area is very small and there is only one bartender to attend to all the patrons. If you want a cocktail order from the dining room you will get it faster. There is no gift shop no shopping nearby but the hotel shuttle is willing to drop you off pick you up on their way to and from their airport run.

Could be improved. Room was not cleaned after the first night I stayed. Temperature was always a few degrees colder than temperature at which you set the thermostat. Noises easily carry from adjacent rooms.
Staff was very rude. Never received maid service once throughout our entire stay. Asked about it but was ignored. Faucet leaked in bathroom non stop. Broken door handle in room.
Nice place to stay in Phoenix. It is close to airport. It has his own mini van to give ride passenger from airport. Room was very nice and clean.
Nice Hotel clean rooms and courteous staff.
Close proximity to airport and rooms are in good shape. Staff were receptive. Entrance was a little difficult to find at night.

This Mariot is located near the highway with easy access and visibility. Room was very clean and updated as well as the rest of the amenities. I do appreciate that the fitness facility actually had machines that were not only cardio and a rack of dumbbells. Shopping is near by in case you are the type of traveller that enjoys getting out.
Clean and comfortable room. Very good both breakfast and location. Everything was good.

Nice rooms at least on concierge floor. Lounge not open on weekend and being renovated now. Breakfast in restaurant is subpar. Pool water was cold maybe refrigerated given the outside air temperature now. Free parking and airport shuttle.

Nice rooms but very noisy. Condition of the hotel was excellent. The renovated rooms looked excellent. One major issue is the doors between the rooms are not sound proof and allow any and all noise from the neighboring room to be transmitted into our room. Every footstep ever conversation every bathroom noise Could not sleep. My wife and I had a better night sleep at a motel 6.
Great staff and clean rooms nice bars.
Wonderful staff food and room. Fair price. Valet parking. Pool is open late. Restaurant open late. Right next to the light rail. Excellent gym equipment.
Super usual quality. Nice bar and dining room. Friendly helpful staff. Shuttle convenient to airport.
